author: Jorge Valero
description: The European Union dodged an imminent trade war with the US this week, but markets and a growing chorus of critics have dispelled early hopes that the deal will bring a sense of stability back to transatlantic relations.
title: EU and US Rush to Nail Down Final Details and Lock In Trade Deal

author: Oscar Medina
description: A Colombian judge said former President Álvaro Uribe Vélez committed bribery in a witness tampering probe, potentially becoming the first Colombian head of state to be convicted of a crime.
title: Colombian Judge Finds Ex-President Uribe Committed Bribery

author: Stephan Kueffner
description: Peru’s President Dina Boluarte pledged to keep her nation’s market-friendly economic policies in place and to tackle growing crime en route to a handover of power next year in her final state of the nation speech.
title: Peru’s Boluarte Pledges to Stay the Course Until Next Vote

author: Janet Lorin
description: The US Education Department said Monday that it has launched an investigation of Duke University and the Duke Law Journal over allegations of civil rights violations, the latest move by the Trump administration to probe schools over their hiring and admissions processes.
title: Duke University Probed by Education Department Over Civil Rights Violations

author: Nathan R Dean
description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Every Monday, Bloomberg Intelligence senior analyst Nathan Dean gives his insights into what’s been happening and what’s coming up in the nooks and crannies of government and markets.  Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Trump Dials Up Pressure on Russia With Tariff Risk in Background

author: Bob Van Voris
description: A federal judge in Washington denied a request by an investment firm led by an ally of President Donald Trump for public access to Tuesday’s Federal Open Market Committee meeting.
title: Trump Ally Loses Bid to Open July 29 Fed Meeting to Public

author: Brian Platt
description: Stephen Harper calls himself the most pro-American prime minister in Canadian history. But the advice he gave recently to Mark Carney’s government was to take a different path — and reduce the country’s close integration with the US.
title: A Canadian Conservative Icon Advises Carney to Pull Back From US

author: Sherif Tarek
description: Saudi Arabia can normalize ties with Israel only after the establishment of a Palestinian state, Foreign Minister Prince Faisal Bin Farhan said, reiterating the kingdom’s stance days after President Emmanuel Macron said France would recognize it in September.
title: Saudi Arabia Says Palestinian State a Must for Ties With Israel

author: Anya Andrianova, Ezra Fieser
description: The dollar jumped the most since early May, putting it on track for its first monthly gain this year, bolstered by a long-awaited trade deal between the US and the European Union.
title: Dollar Jumps Most Since May After US and EU Reach Trade Deal

author: Cam Kettles, Gregory Korte
description: In May, the Department of Government Efficiency, or DOGE, lost its architect and de facto leader, Elon Musk. But without Musk, who brandished a literal chainsaw as a symbol of the group’s aggressive cost-cutting program, the Trump administration is continuing to make cuts — and quietly insinuating DOGE into the fabric of government.
title: What Is DOGE Without Elon Musk?

author: Zoe Tillman
description: A US trade court has for now denied an effort to restore a tariff exemption for small-value packages from China that President Donald Trump ended earlier this year.
title: Court Declines US Tariff Relief on Low-Cost Goods, for Now

author: Michael D McDonald
description: Honduran opposition presidential candidate Nasry Asfura vowed to forge closer ties with the US, restore relations with Taiwan and capitalize on the skills of returning migrants to revitalize the economy.
title: Honduras Presidential Rival Vows to Embrace US, Rebuff China

author: Arne Delfs
description: German Chancellor Friedrich Merz called on Israel to immediately alleviate the “catastrophic” humanitarian crisis in Gaza as European governments harden their positions.
title: Merz Calls on Israel to Stop ‘Catastrophic’ Crisis in Gaza

author: Patpicha Tanakasempipat
description: Thailand expects the Trump administration to offer it a “very good” trade deal after agreeing to end an armed border conflict with Cambodia under a US-backed peace initiative, its Acting Prime Minister Phumtham Wechayachai said.
title: Thailand Sees US Offering ‘Very Good’ Trade Deal After Ceasefire

author: Skylar Woodhouse
description: President Donald Trump said he had asked US officials to resume trade negotiations with Cambodia and Thailand after the countries agreed to halt fighting along a disputed border.
title: Trump to Resume Trade Talks With Cambodia, Thailand After Truce

author: Brian Platt
description: Prime Minister Mark Carney said his government is still in deep trade talks with the Trump administration despite recent comments from the US president that suggested a deal with Canada wasn’t a priority.
title: Carney Says US-Canada Trade Negotiations at ‘Intense Phase’

author: Kerim Karakaya
description: Ukrainian bonds rose the most in a month after US President Donald Trump pressured Russia’s Vladimir Putin to quickly stop the war in Ukraine.
title: Ukraine Bonds Rally as Trump Pressures Russia for Quick Truce

author: Alex Wickham
description: President Donald Trump suggested Prime Minister Keir Starmer needed to lower taxes, cut immigration and stop crime in the UK if he wants to beat populist Nigel Farage at the next general election.
title: Trump Tells UK’s Starmer to Cut Taxes, Migration to Beat Farage

author: Ellen Milligan, Gerry Doyle, Anthony Capaccio
description: The US has likely stationed nuclear weapons in the UK for the first time since 2008, in a signal to Russian President Vladimir Putin that it remains committed to European security.
title: US Has Likely Moved Nuclear Weapons to UK First Time Since 2008

author: Emma Court, Olivia Raimonde
description: From clean energy and research to advocacy, nonprofit groups are struggling as federal dollars dry up. Foundations say they won’t be able to fill funding gaps.
title: Trump’s Billions in Climate Cuts Have Nonprofits Scrambling to Survive

author: Skylar Woodhouse, Hadriana Lowenkron
description: President Donald Trump said the US would work on a new effort to provide food aid to alleviate starvation in Gaza along with other governments and organizations, including the UK and European Union.
title: Trump Proposes Gaza ‘Food Centers,’ Says Starvation Is Real

author: Kamil Kowalcze
description: Germany’s push to rearm in response to mounting Russian aggression in Europe will see its annual defense budget double to as much as €162 billion ($189 billion) within four years.
title: Germany Aims for NATO Goal With €162 Billion Budget by 2029

author: Skylar Woodhouse, Hadriana Lowenkron
description: US President Donald Trump said he would cut the timeline for Russian leader Vladimir Putin to reach a truce with Ukraine or face potential economic penalties, ramping up pressure on Moscow to bring the fighting to a halt.
title: Trump Says He Will Give Putin New 10-12 Day Truce Deadline

author: Alex Wickham, Joe Mayes
description: UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer will propose a plan for peace in Gaza in a meeting with President Donald Trump on Monday, designed to deliver immediate humanitarian relief on the ground as well as charting a path to a two-state solution.
title: UK’s Starmer to Propose Gaza Peace Plan to Trump and Allies

author: Antony Sguazzin
description: Zimbabwe’s best chance of exiting a 25-year debt default is to engage the Group of 20 nations to help formulate a solution and stop trying to work its way out of the quagmire itself, World Bank President Ajay Banga said.
title: World Bank Chief Says Zimbabwe Needs G-20 Help to Exit Debt Trap

description: ATLANTA (AP) — Georgia Republican Mike Collins said Monday that he will join the field challenging Democratic U.S. Sen. Jon Ossoff in the state the GOP has named as their top target to add a Senate seat in 2026.
title: Georgia Republican Mike Collins Joins 2026 Field to Challenge Democratic Sen. Jon Ossoff

author: Philip Aldrick
description: Britain’s National Health Service is almost a tenth less productive than before the pandemic, official figures show, a performance that will renew concerns about value-for-money for the taxpayer amid a fresh wave of doctor strikes.
title: UK National Health Service Productivity Lags as Doctors Strike

author: Paula Sambo
description: General Motors is exposed to billions in costs from the trade war. The residents of Oshawa are already paying the price.
title: Auto Tariffs Stoke Layoff Angst in Canada's Once-Proud Motor City

author: Anthony Halpin
description: The EU-US trade deal shows that dependence on Washington makes allies vulnerable.
title: Trump’s Pressure Yields Results — But at What Cost?

author: Yian Lee
description: An unprecedented move backed by Taiwan President Lai Ching-te to unseat more than a quarter of the island’s legislators was overwhelmingly rejected during the first of two “recall” elections.
title: Why Taiwan Is Holding a Recall Vote Opposed by China

author: Jenny Leonard, Yian Lee
description: The Trump administration is debating whether to allow a planned US stopover by Taiwan’s leader next week as concerns mount that it could derail trade talks with China and a potential summit with President Xi Jinping, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: Trump Weighs Whether to Let Taiwan Leader Transit Through US

author: Richard Bravo
description: European capitals are putting a brave face on the trade deal they struck with President Donald Trump, which will see the European Union accept a 15% tariff on most of its exports to the US while reducing levies on some American products to zero.
title: EU Welcomes Pause in US Trade Fight While Seeking Better Terms

author: Alberto Nardelli
description: Several European Union officials responsible for negotiating Sunday’s trade agreement with the US think the deal they hammered out was the least-bad option available to the bloc, according to people familiar with their thinking.
title: Merz and Macron Just Didn’t Want to Get Into a Trade War With Trump

author: Karoline Kan
description: China announced that it will start handing out childcare subsidies across the nation, in its latest push to boost birthrates after a worrying drop in recent years.
title: China Rolls Out Childcare Subsidy to Boost Birth Rate

author: Andreo Calonzo, Cliff Harvey Venzon
description: Philippine President Ferdinand Marcos Jr. said recent midterm elections showed the public’s discontent over issues ranging from poverty to corruption, pledging to roll out more social programs, create jobs and attract investment in the second half of his single six-year term.
title: Philippines’ Marcos Pushes More Social Programs, Jobs to Soothe Public Discontent

author: Willem Marx
description: Projects on the Isle of Lewis were stalled for decades, but the perseverance of local leaders overcame regulatory obstacles and community concerns.
title: Scottish Wind Farms Show How to Counter Nimby Opposition

author: Tracy Alloway, Joe Weisenthal
description: President Trump has announced tariffs on basically every trading partner. However there is a real sense that the ultimate goal is to hamper the perceived economic threat from China. One vision for how the trade war could be “won” in some sense is by isolating China from the rest of the world. But that’s not happening. And in fact, if anything, China is deepening its relationship with other trading nations right now, particularly in Asia. On this episode we speak with Cameron Johnson, a partner a
title: Odd Lots: How Chinese Firms Are Reacting to US Tariffs (Podcast)

author: Patpicha Tanakasempipat, Ram Anand
description: Thai and Cambodian leaders began talks aimed at ending their deadliest border conflict in more than a decade, as the US and regional powers push for a ceasefire and diplomatic resolution.
title: Thailand, Cambodia Start Ceasefire Talks Amid Trump Trade Threat

author: Olesia Safronova
description: Ukraine faced another Russian drone and missile attack early Monday, with air raid alerts sounding across the country for at least six hours since midnight Kyiv time.
title: Poland Scrambles Jets as Russia Launches Strikes on Ukraine

author: Patricia Laya, Andreina Itriago
description: President Nicolás Maduro said his ruling socialist party won a majority of mayorships in Sunday’s local elections, solidifying its hold on power and pushing Venezuela further into one-party rule.
title: Venezuela Ruling Party Sweeps Vote, Cementing One-Party Rule

author: Soo-Hyang Choi
description: South Korea is pitching the US on a shipbuilding partnership as a key proposal to seal a last-minute agreement to avoid a 25% tariff rate.
title: Korea Pitches Trump on Shipyards for Last-Minute Trade Deal

author: Yoshiaki Nohara
description: Japan expects only 1-2% of its recently agreed upon $550 billion US fund to be in the form of actual investment, with the bulk of the funds to be dispersed via loans, according to the nation’s top chief negotiator Ryosei Akazawa.
title: Japan Expects 1%-2% of $550 Billion US Fund to Be Investment

author: Soo-Hyang Choi
description: North Korea rejected overtures for dialogue from the new administration in Seoul, signaling that Pyongyang retains a hardline stance after the election of South Korean President Lee Jae Myung.
title: North Korea Rebuffs New South Leader’s Attempt to Ease Tensions

author: Andreo Calonzo, Cliff Harvey Venzon
description: Fresh from tariff talks with President Donald Trump, Philippine leader Ferdinand Marcos Jr. is on Monday set to unveil plans to boost growth as he starts the second half of his single six-year term beset with economic and political risks.
title: Tariffs, Duterte Risks Loom as Philippines’ Marcos Charts Last Years in Power

author: Alisha Sachdev
description: China’s BYD Co. is forging ahead with its attempts to expand in India despite roadblocks from the government that are preventing the electric vehicle maker from conducting key business dealings there.
title: BYD Runs India Remotely as China Tensions Shut Out Top Brass

author: Alastair Gale
description: Japanese Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba’s resolve to remain in power will be tested Monday at a rare meeting of all the ruling Liberal Democratic Party’s lawmakers to assess the reasons for the party’s recent election setback.
title: Japan’s Ishiba to Face Crunch Meeting of LDP Lawmakers Monday
